keyPolicies.policyDescription: Put police back on the street. Provide more Community Support Officers. No to Labour's expensive ID cards.
Create 1,000 paid work experience places for young people. Invest in Birmingham's businesses. Working to protect key services from Labour's cuts.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Better access to higher Education & training
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Further increase average exam results. Increase numeracy and literacy skills. Continue to build and renovate schools.
Clear all fly tipping and grafitti within 48 hours. Increase recycling rate. Expand kerb side collections. A continuous programme to reduce CO2 emissions.
500 newly built Council homes. 300 renovated and run down homes renovated and brought back into use.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Cut congestion, better transport for all
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Provide low cost off peak travel for everyone. Introduce an expressway route across the city. Double previous bus rail links and stations.

issues.economy: Create 1,000 paid work experience places for young people. Invest in Birmingham's businesses. Working to protect key services from Labour's cuts.
issues.education: Further increase average exam results. Increase numeracy and literacy skills. Continue to build and renovate schools.
issues.environment: Clear all fly tipping and grafitti within 48 hours. Increase recycling rate. Expand kerb side collections. A continuous programme to reduce CO2 emissions.

housing.content: Provide 1,000 new social homes by 2010, which includes 500 newly built Council homes and 300 renovated and run down homes brought back into use.

images.caption: Image captions not identified from the leaflet.

leaflet.additionalNotes: These are the things for the Council to do before May 2011. Encourages readers to rank the issues in order of importance.
